page.title: 12Thurnham Hall.
page.content: Thurnham Hall is an ancient house dating from the 13th century set in an historic and forgotten part of the country for over 800 years. It is owned by Mr.& Mrs.S.H.Crabtree who have no hereditary connections with the Hall. They bought Thurnham Hall in 1973,mainly for commercial reasons,opening it to the public in 1975 as a small stately home,after two years extensive renovation work.It is open from Easter until the end of October.It is a perfect example of architecture through the ages major portion 16thC through to the 19thC with a small and unique private chapel of Gothic style.It contains a fine Elizabethan hall,Jacobean staircase, beautiful restored panelling,plaster work and priests hide.It has a gift shop and serves cream teas in the summer.
